intro: Buchnera denticulata, commonly known as the toothed Buchnera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Buchnera denticulata typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
